CONCLUSION: Questions of procedure rejected;No violation of Art. 7
TEXT: CARDINAL . The purpose of the ORG 's request - to which is appended the ORG drawn up by the Commission in accordance with the provisions of LAW article CARDINAL ) of the Convention - is to submit the case of ORG to the ORG so that it may decide whether or not the facts of the case disclose that ORG has failed in its obligations under LAW .

As appears from the ORG 's request and from its ORG , ORG alleges in his ORG that , in his case , the LAW has been violated by the authorities of GPE , inasmuch as , in pursuance of an Order made by the Minister of ORG under LAW No . DATE amending the ORG against LAW , DATE , he was detained without trial , DATE and CARDINALth DATE , in a military detention camp situated in the territory of GPE .

CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as they appear from the Report of the ORG , the memorials , evidence and documents laid before the ORG and the statements made by the ORG and by ORG during the oral hearings before the ORG , are in substance as follows :
CARDINAL . ORG is a builder 's labourer , born in DATE . He is ordinarily resident in GPE ( GPE ) .

CARDINAL . ORG admitted before the Commission that he had become a member of the IRA ( " ORG " ) in DATE . According to his own statements , he left the ORG in DATE and a splinter group of the ORG in DATE .
CARDINAL . Under the LAW establishing ORG , signed on DATE between GPE and ORG , CARDINAL counties situated in LOC remained under NORP sovereignty .

CARDINAL . On several occasions since the foundation of ORG , armed groups , calling themselves ORG " ( IRA ) , have been formed , for the avowed purpose of carrying out acts of violence to put an end to NORP sovereignty in GPE . At times the activities of these groups have been such that effective repression by the ordinary process of law was not possible . From time to time , the legislature has , therefore , conferred upon the Government special powers deal with the situation created by these unlawful activities ; and such powers have sometimes included the power of detention without trial .
On DATE the LAW at present in force in GPE was promulgated . In DATE all persons detained for political offences were released .
When the political situation in LOC foreshadowed war , the ORG resumed its activities and committed fresh acts of violence .

At DATE the IRA published documents described by it as a " declaration of war on GPE " . Following that declaration , the ORG , operating from territory of GPE , intensified its acts of violence on NORP territory .
CARDINAL . In order to meet the situation created by the activities of the ORG , ORG passed the LAW against LAW , DATE , which came into force on DATE .

CARDINAL . Part II of LAW defines the " activities prejudicial to the preservation of public peace and order or to the security of the ORG " . Part III contains provisions relating to organisations whose activities come under the LAW and any which may therefore be declared an " unlawful organisation " by order of the Government . LAW of LAW provides as follows :
" ( CARDINAL ) It shall not be lawful for any person to be a member of an unlawful organisation ;
( CARDINAL ) Every person who is a member of an unlawful organisation in contravention of this section shall be guilty of an offence under this section and shall :

( a ) on summary conviction thereof , be liable to a fine not exceeding QUANTITY , or at the discretion of the court , to imprisonment for a term not exceeding DATE or to both such fine and such imprisonment ; or
( b ) on conviction thereof on indictment , be liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding DATE . "

Part DATE the CARDINAL Act contains various provisions relating to the repression of unlawful activities , including , in LAW , the following provision relating to the arrest and detention of persons suspected of being concerned in unlawful activities :

" ( CARDINAL ) A member of ORG ( if he is not in uniform on production of his identity card if demanded ) may without warrant stop , search , interrogate , and arrest any person , or do any one or more of those things in respect of any person , whom he suspects of having committed or being about to commit or being or having been concerned in the commission of an offence under any section or sub - section of this LAW , or an offence which is for the time being a scheduled offence for the purposes of Part V of this LAW or whom he suspects of carrying a document relating to the commission or intended commission of any such offence as aforesaid .

( CARDINAL ) Any member of PERSON ( if he is not in uniform on production of his identity card if demanded ) may , for the purpose of the exercise of any of the powers conferred by the next preceding sub - section of this section , stop and search ( if necessary by force ) any vehicle or any ship , boat , or other vessel which he suspects to contain a person whom he is empowered by the said sub - section to arrest without warrant .

( CARDINAL ) Whenever a person is arrested under this section , he may be removed to and detained in custody in a NORP FAC station , a prison , or some other convenient place for a period of QUANTITY from the time of his arrest and may , if an officer of ORG not below the rank of Chief Superintendent so directs , be so detained for a further period of TIME .

( CARDINAL ) A person detained under the next preceding sub - section of this section may , at any time during such detention , be charged before ORG or a ORG with an offence , or be released by direction of an officer of ORG , and shall , if not so charged or released , be released at the expiration of the detention authorised by the said sub - section .
( CARDINAL ) A member of PERSON may do all or any of the following things in respect of a person detained under this section , that is to say :
( a ) demand of such person his name and address ;
( b ) search such person or cause him to be searched ;
( c ) photograph such person or cause him to be photographed ;
( d ) take , or cause to be taken , the fingerprints of such person .

( CARDINAL ) Every person who shall obstruct or impede the exercise in respect of him by a member of ORG of any of the powers conferred by the next preceding sub - section of this section or shall fail or refuse to give his name and address or shall give , in response to any such demand , a name or an address which is false or misleading shall be guilty of an offence under this section and shall be liable on summary conviction thereof to imprisonment for a term not exceeding DATE . "
Part V of LAW is concerned with the establishment of " Special Criminal Courts " to try persons charged with offences under LAW .
Lastly , Part VI of LAW contained provisions authorising any

Minister of ORG - once the Government had brought that Part of the LAW into force - to order , in certain circumstances , the arrest and detention of any person whom he was satisfied was engaged in activities declared unlawful by the LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE , i.e. DATE after the entry into force of the Offences Against the State Act , the ORG made an order under LAW of the LAW that the ORG , declared an " unlawful organisation " , be dissolved .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL persons were subsequently arrested and detained under Part VI of the LAW . CARDINAL of those persons brought an action in ORG of GPE , challenging the validity of his detention . ORG declared the detention illegal and ordered the release of the person concerned by writ of habeas corpus .
The Government had all the persons detained under the same clauses released forthwith .

CARDINAL . Taking note of ORG judgment , the ORG tabled in ORG a Bill to amend Part VI of the ORG against LAW DATE . The PERSON , after being declared constitutional by ORG , was passed by ORG on DATE , becoming the ORG against LAW , DATE ( No . DATE ) .

This Act No . DATE confers on Ministers of State special powers of detention without trial , " if and whenever and so often as the ORG makes and publishes a proclamation declaring that the powers conferred by this Part of this LAW are necessary to secure the preservation of public peace and order and that it is expedient that this Part of this LAW should come into force immediately " ( section CARDINAL , sub - section ( CARDINAL ) of the LAW ) .

Under LAW , sub - section ( CARDINAL ) of the LAW , however , a Government proclamation bringing into force the special powers of detention may be annulled at any time by a simple resolution of ORG of ORG .
Moreover , under LAW must be kept fully informed , at regular intervals , of the manner in which the powers of detention have been exercised .
CARDINAL . The powers of detention referred to in the LAW are vested in ORG . LAW provides as follows :

" ( CARDINAL ) Whenever a Minister of ORG is of opinion that any particular person is engaged in activities which , in his opinion , are prejudicial to the preservation of public peace and order or to the security of the ORG , such Minister may by warrant under his hand and sealed with his official seal order the arrest and detention of such person under this section .
( CARDINAL ) Any member of PERSON may arrest without warrant any person in respect of whom a warrant has been issued by a Minister of ORG under the foregoing sub - section of this section .

( CARDINAL ) Every person arrested under the next preceding sub - section of this section shall be detained in a prison or other place prescribed in that behalf by regulations made under this Part of this LAW until this Part of this LAW ceases to be in force or until he is released under the subsequent provisions of this Part of this LAW , whichever first happens .

( CARDINAL ) Whenever a person is detained under this section , there shall be furnished to such person , as soon as may be after he arrives at a prison or other place of detention prescribed in that behalf by regulations made under this Part of this LAW , a copy of the warrant issued under this section in relation to such person and of the provisions of LAW CARDINAL of this Act " .

CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL of the Offences against GPE , DATE , the ORG is required to set up , as soon as conveniently may be after the entry into force of the powers of detention without trial , a Commission ( hereinafter referred to as " ORG " ) to which any person arrested or detained under the Act may apply , through the Government , to have his case considered . The Commission is to consist of CARDINAL persons , appointed by the Government , one to be a commissioned officer of ORG with not DATE service and each of the others to be a barrister or solicitor of not DATE standing or a judge or former judge of CARDINAL of the ordinary courts . Lastly , section CARDINAL of the LAW provides that , if the ORG reports that no reasonable grounds exist for the continued detention of the person concerned , such person shall , with all convenient speed , be released .
CARDINAL . After DATE during which there was very little IRA activity , there was a renewed outbreak in DATE and again in DATE .

In DATE armed attacks were made on a number of GPE police barracks and at DATE a policeman was killed . In DATE a police patrol on border roads was fired on , trees were felled across roads and telephone wires cut , etc . In DATE there were more incidents of the same kind . At DATE there was an armed attack on FAC during which CARDINAL of the assailants were killed ; both of them came from the CARDINAL area . CARDINAL others , of whom CARDINAL were wounded , fled across the border and were arrested by the police of GPE . Thereupon , the Prime Minister of GPE , in a public broadcast address on CARDINALth DATE , made a pressing appeal to the public to put an end to these attacks .

DATE after this broadcast , namely , on DATE , the IRA carried out an armed raid on an explosives store in the territory of GPE , situated at GPE , for the purpose of stealing explosives . On CARDINALth DATE , armed groups entered an explosives store at PERSON , held up the watchman and stole a quantity of explosives .
On DATE , the main railway line from GPE to GPE was closed by an explosion which caused extensive damage to the railway bridge at GPE , QUANTITY on the northern side of the border .
During TIME of CARDINALth-CARDINALth DATE , CARDINAL explosions between GPE and GPE , in GPE , also damaged the same railway line .

On TIME a GPE police patrol on duty a short distance from the border was ambushed . CARDINAL policeman was shot dead and another injured . At the scene of the ambush CARDINAL sticks of gelignite were found to have been placed on the road and covered with stones , with wires leading to a detonator .

This incident occurred DATE before the DATE Orange Processions which are widespread throughout GPE on DATE . In the past , this date has been particularly critical for the maintenance of peace and public order .
CARDINAL . The special powers of arrest and detention conferred upon the Ministers of State by DATE LAW were brought into force on DATE by a Proclamation of ORG published in ORG on DATE .
On DATE , the ORG set up ORG provided for in CARDINAL of that LAW and appointed as members of that Commission an officer of ORG , a judge and a district ORG .
CARDINAL . The Proclamation by which ORG brought into force on DATE the special powers of detention provided for in Part II of the CARDINAL Act ( No . CARDINAL ) read as follows :

" The Government , in exercise of the powers conferred on them by sub - section ( CARDINAL ) of LAW against LAW , DATE , ( No . DATE ) , hereby declare that the powers conferred by Part II of the said LAW are necessary to secure the preservation of public peace and order and that it is expedient that the said part of the said LAW should come into force immediately . "
CARDINAL . By letter of DATE the NORP Minister for ORG informed the Secretary - ORG that Part II of the ORG against LAW , DATE ( No . CARDINAL ) had come into force on DATE .
Paragraph CARDINAL of that letter read as follows :

" ... Insofar as the bringing into operation of Part II of the Act , which confers special powers of arrest and detention , may involve any derogation from the obligations imposed by LAW , I have the honour to request you to be good enough to regard this letter as informing you accordingly , in compliance with LAW ) ( article LAW ) of the Convention . "

The letter pointed out that the detention of persons under LAW was considered necessary " to prevent the commission of offences against public peace and order and to prevent the maintaining of military or armed forces other than those authorised by LAW . "
The Secretary - General 's attention was called to section CARDINAL of the LAW which provides for the establishment of a Commission to which any detained person can appeal . ORG was set up on DATE .

CARDINAL . Soon after the publication of the Proclamation of CARDINALth DATE bringing into force the powers of detention provided for under LAW , the Prime Minister of ORG announced that the Government would release any person held under that LAW who undertook " to respect the LAW and the laws of GPE " and " to refrain from being a member of or assisting any organisation declared unlawful under the ORG against LAW , DATE " .

CARDINAL . ORG was first arrested with CARDINAL other men on DATE in a disused barn at GPE , County Leitrim . The police discovered in the barn a ORG machine - gun , CARDINAL army rifles , CARDINAL sporting guns , a revolver , an automatic pistol and CARDINAL magazines . Lawless admitted that he was a member of the IRA and that he had taken part in an armed raid when guns and revolvers had been stolen . He was subsequently charged on DATE with unlawful possession of firearms under LAW , DATE and under LAW of the LAW against LAW DATE .

ORG , together with the other accused , was sent forward for trial to ORG . On DATE , they were acquitted of the charge of unlawful possession of arms . The trial judge had directed the jury that the requirements for proving the accussed 's guilt had not been satisfied in that it not been conclusively shown that no competent authority had issued a firearm certificate authorising him to be in possession of the arms concerned .
At the hearing before this Court on DATE , ORG asked CARDINAL of the accused , PERSON , whether he wished to put any questions to any of the policemen present . PERSON replied as follows :
" As a soldier of ORG and as leader of these men , I do not wish to have any part in proceedings in this ORG . "
When asked by the ORG whether he pleaded guilty or not guilty to the charge , he again said :

" On behalf of my comrades and myself I wish to state that any arms and ammunition found on us were to be used against the NORP Forces of occupation to bring about the re - unification of our country and no NORP or woman of any political persuasion had anything to fear from us . We hold that it is legal to possess arms and also believe it is the duty of every NORP to bear arms in defence of his country . "
Subsequently , ORG in reply to a question by the ORG said : " PERSON spoke for me . "

Lawless was again arrested in GPE on CARDINALth DATE under LAW , on suspicion of engaging in unlawful activities . A sketch map for an attack of certain frontier posts between GPE and GPE was found on him bearing the inscription " Infiltrate , annihilate and destroy . "
On DATE his house was searched by the police who found a manuscript document on guerrilla warfare containing , inter alia , the following statements :

" The resistance movement is the armed vanguard of the NORP people fighting for the freedom of GPE . The strength of the movement consists in the popular patriotic character of the movement . The basic mission of local resistance units are the destruction of enemy installations and establishments that is PERSON halls , special huts , ORG recruiting offices , border huts , depots , etc .

Attacks against enemy aerodromes and the destruction of aircraft hangars , depots of bombs and fuel , the killing of key flying personnel and mechanics , the killing or capture of high - ranking enemy officers and high officials of the enemy 's colonial Government and traitors to our country in their pay , that is , NORP officers , police agents , touts , judges , high members of the Quisling party , etc . "
After being arrested , ORG was charged :
( a ) with possession of incriminating documents contrary to LAW ;
( b ) with membership of an unlawful organisation , the ORG , contrary to section QUANTITY of LAW .

On DATE , ORG was brought before ORG together with CARDINAL other men who were also charged with similar offences under LAW . The ORG convicted PERSON on the first charge and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment ; it acquitted him on the second charge . The ORG record showed that the second charge was dismissed " on the merits " of the case but no official report of the proceedings appears to be available . The reasons for this acquittal were not clearly established . ORG was released on DATE , after having served his sentence in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . PERSON was re - arrested on CARDINALth DATE at ORG by Security Officer PERSON when about to embark on a ship for GPE . He was detained for TIME at FAC in GPE under LAW , as being a suspected member of an unlawful organisation , namely the IRA .

Detective - Inspector PERSON told the PERSON on DATE that he would be released provided that he signed an undertaking in regard to his future conduct . No written form of the undertaking proposed was put to ORG and its exact terms are in dispute .
On CARDINALth DATE , ORG , acting under LAW , sub - section CARDINAL of LAW , made an order that ORG be detained for a further period of TIME expiring at TIME on DATE .

At TIME on CARDINALth DATE , however , before ORG detention under LAW had expired , he was removed from ORG and transferred to the military prison in ORG ( known as the " Glass House " ) . He arrived there at TIME on DATE and was detained from that time under an order made on DATE by the Minister for ORG under LAW . Upon his arrival at FAC " , he was handed a copy of the above - mentioned detention order in which the Minister for ORG declared that ORG was , in his opinion , engaged in activities prejudicial to the security of the ORG and he ordered his arrest and detention under section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act .

From the " Glass House " , ORG was transferred on DATE to a camp known as the " Curragh Internment Camp " , which forms part of ORG and GPE in GPE , and together with CARDINAL other persons , was detained there without charge or trial until CARDINALth DATE when he was released .

CARDINAL . On DATE G.R. Lawless was informed that he would be released provided he gave an undertaking in writing " to respect the LAW and laws of GPE " and not to " be a member of or assist any organisation which is an unlawful organisation under the ORG against LAW DATE . " ORG declined to give this undertaking .

CARDINAL . On DATE G.R. Lawless exercised the right , conferred upon him by section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act , to apply to have the continuation of his detention considered by ORG set up under the same section of that LAW . He appeared before that Commission on DATE and was represented by counsel and solicitors . ORG , sitting for the first time , adopted certain rules of procedure and adjourned until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , however , ORG counsel also made an application to ORG , under LAW , for a Conditional Order of habeas corpus ad subjiciendum . The object of the application was that the ORG should order the Commandant of the detention camp to bring ORG before the ORG in order that it might examine and decide upon the validity of detention . A Conditional Order of habeas corpus would have the effect of requiring the Commandant to " show cause " to ORG why he should not comply with that Order .

The Conditional Order was granted on DATE and was served on the Commandant giving him DATE to " show cause " . It was also served upon ORG . ORG sat on DATE , and decided to adjourn the hearing sine die pending the outcome of the habeas corpus application .

CARDINAL . ORG then applied , by a motion to ORG , to have ORG made " absolute " , notwithstanding the fact that the Commandant of FAC had in the meantime " shown cause " opposing this application . The Commandant had , in this connection , relied upon the order for the PERSON 's detention which had been made by the Minister for ORG .

ORG sat from DATE and heard full legal submissions by counsel for both parties . On DATE it gave judgment allowing the " cause shown " by the camp Commandant to justify detention . The habeas corpus application was therefore dismissed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG appealed to ORG , invoking not only the LAW and laws of GPE but also ORG . On DATE ORG dismissed ORG appeal . It gave its reasoned judgment on DATE .
The main grounds of ORG judgment were as follows :

( a ) LAW , when in draft form as a PERSON , had been referred to ORG for decision as to whether it was repugnant to LAW . ORG had decided that it was not repugnant and LAW declared that no court had competence to question the constitutional validity of a law which had been approved as a PERSON by ORG .

( b ) The ORG ( i.e. the ORG ) which was the sole legislative authority had not introduced legislation to make ORG part of the municipal law of GPE . ORG could not , therefore , give effect to the LAW if it should appear to grant rights other than , or supplementary to , those provided under NORP municipal law .

( c ) The appellant 's period of detention under LAW was due to expire at TIME on DATE . At that time he was already being detained under another warrant issued by the Minister for ORG and his detention without release was quite properly continued under the second warrant .

( d ) The appellant had not established a prima facie case in regard to his allegation that he had not been told the reason for his arrest under the Minister 's warrant . An invalidity in the arrest , even if established , would not , however , have rendered his subsequent detention unlawful whatever rights it might otherwise have given the appellant under NORP law .

( e ) The ORG had already decided , when considering the DATE Act as a PERSON , that it had no power to question the opinion of a Minister who issued a warrant for detention under section CARDINAL of that Act .

( f ) The appellant in the habeas corpus proceedings before ORG had challenged the legality of the constitution of ORG . Even if it was shown that the ORG 's rulings on various procedural matters were wrong , that would not make the appellant 's detention unlawful nor would it provide a basis for an application for habeas corpus . LAW showed that the ORG was not a court and an application before it was not a form of proceedings but no more than an enquiry of an administrative character .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE - that is DATE after the announcement of ORG rejection of his appeal - ORG had introduced his ORG before ORG , alleging that his arrest and detention under LAW , without charge or trial , violated the LAW and he claimed :
( a ) immediate release from detention ;
( b ) payment of compensation and damages for his detention ;
and
( c ) payment of all the costs and expenses of , and incidental to the proceedings instituted by him in the NORP courts and before the ORG to secure his release .

CARDINAL . Shortly afterwards ORG resumed its consideration of the case of ORG under section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL LAW and held hearings for that purpose on CARDINALth and CARDINALth DATE . On DATE , at the invitation of the Attorney - General , ORG in person before ORG gave a verbal undertaking that he would not " engage in any illegal activities under the ORG against ORG , DATE and DATE " , and on DATE an order was made by the Minister for ORG , under section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act , releasing the Applicant from detention .

CARDINAL . The release of ORG from detention was notified to ORG by his solicitor in a letter dated DATE . The letter at the same time stated that ORG intended to continue the proceedings before the Commission with regard to ( a ) the claim for compensation and damages for his detention and ( b ) the claim for reimbursement of all costs and expenses in connection with the proceedings undertaken to obtain his release .
CARDINAL . At the written and oral proceedings before the ORG , ORG and ORG made the following submissions :
The Commission , in its Memorial of DATE :
" DATE it please the ORG to take into consideration the findings of the Commission in its ORG on the case of PERSON and
( CARDINAL ) to decide :

( a ) whether or not the detention of the Applicant without trial from CARDINALth July to CARDINALth DATE under LAW against LAW , DATE , was in conflict with the obligations of ORG under DATE and CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL , article CARDINAL ) of the ORG ;
( b ) whether or not such detention was in conflict with the obligations of ORG under LAW ;
( CARDINAL ) if such detention was in conflict with the obligations of ORG under DATE and CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL , article CARDINAL ) of the LAW , to decide :
( a ) whether or not the ORG 's letter to the Secretary - General of DATE was a sufficient communication for the purposes of LAW , paragraph ( CARDINAL ) ( article CARDINAL ) of the Convention ;

( b ) whether or not , from DATE , there existed a public emergency threatening the life of the nation , within the meaning of LAW , paragraph ( CARDINAL ) ( article CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the Convention ;

( c ) if such an emergency did exist during that period , whether or not the measure of detaining persons without trial under LAW , as it was applied by the Government , was a measure strictly required by the exigencies of the situation ;

( CARDINAL ) to decide whether or not the Applicant is , in any event , precluded by LAW ) of the LAW from invoking the provisions of LAW , DATE and DATE ( article CARDINAL , article CARDINAL , article CARDINAL ) ;
( CARDINAL ) in the light of its decisions on the questions in paragraphs CARDINAL of these submissions , to adjudge and declare :
( a ) whether or not the facts disclose any breach by ORG of its obligations under the LAW ;
( b ) if so , what compensation , if any , is due to the Applicant in respect of the breach . "
CARDINAL . The Agent of ORG , at the public hearing on DATE :
" DATE it please the ORG to decide and declare that the answers to the questions contained in paragraph CARDINAL of the ORG 's Memorial of DATE are as follows :
CARDINAL .
( a ) That the detention of the PERSON was not in conflict with the obligations of the ORG under DATE and CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL , article CARDINAL ) of the Convention .
( b ) That such detention was not in conflict with the obligations of the Government under LAW ) of the LAW .
CARDINAL .

( a ) That the ORG 's letter of DATE was a sufficient communication for the purposes of paragraph ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( article LAW ) of the LAW or , alternatively , that in the present case , the Government are not by any of the provisions of the said paragraph ( CARDINAL ) ( article CARDINAL ) deprived from relying on paragraph ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( article LAW ) .
( b ) That from DATE there did exist a public emergency threatening the life of the nation , within the meaning of LAW , paragraph ( CARDINAL ) ( article DATE ) , of the Convention .
( c ) That the measure of detaining persons without trial , as it was applied by the ORG , was a measure strictly required by the exigencies of the situation .

CARDINAL . That the Applicant is in any event precluded by LAW ) of the LAW from invoking the provisions of LAW , DATE and DATE ( article CARDINAL , article CARDINAL , article CARDINAL ) of the Convention .
CARDINAL .
( a ) That the facts do not disclose any breach by the Government of their obligations under the Convention .
( b ) That , by reason of the foregoing , no question of compensation arises . "
